```python
# Object Motion & Parameter Settings
initial_height = 5  # Initial height of the ball
g = 9.81  # Acceleration due to gravity

def reset_animation():
    ball.pos = vector(0, initial_height, 0)
    ball.v = vector(5, 0, 0)  # Initial horizontal velocity
    ball.a = vector(0, -g, 0)  # Acceleration due to gravity

# Create the ball object
ball = sphere(pos=vector(0, initial_height, 0), radius=0.5, color=color.blue, make_trail=True)
reset_animation()

# Ground plane
ground = box(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), size=vector(20, 0.1, 5), color=color.green)

dt = 0.01  # Time step

while True:
    rate(100)
    
    ball.pos = ball.pos + ball.v * dt
    ball.v = ball.v + ball.a * dt
    
    if ball.pos.y <= 0:
        ball.v.y = -ball.v.y  # Bounce off the ground
```

This code sets up the VPython animation for the Horizontal Projectile Motion experiment. The ball is launched horizontally from a specified initial height and bounces elastically upon hitting the ground. The animation will reset whenever the `initial_height` value changes.
